Conor the parrot, a somber allegory for Ukraine's trauma
subhead: After the death of his owner, Anton, Conor withered and appeared to lose the will to live. Tatiana, the widow, could no longer bear to hear him speak in 'the same intonations' as Anton.

'The end of the UK's tax privilege for non-domiciled residents is an opportunity for France'
subhead: Other countries are rushing to fill the gap left by the United Kingdom, but not France. According to academics Nizar Atrissi and Ydriss Ziane, France should adopt a genuine strategy to attract private wealth, with clear, stable and competitive rules.

headline: Tour de France: Cycling's showcase event remains heavily sponsored by fossil fuels
subhead: In late June, TotalEnergies and ASO, the race's organizers, announced a partnership, to begin in 2026. Seven teams competing in the 2025 tour are sponsored by companies or states tied to the production of hydrocarbons.

headline: The challenge of surtitling at the Avignon Festival
subhead: Attracting audiences from around the world, the theater festival features performances in a variety of languages and places a strong emphasis on live translation.

headline: The day Silicon Valley's oligarchs kissed Trump's ring
subhead: 'Tech Oligarchs' (Part 1/6). On January 20, 2025, billionaires including Mark Zuckerberg, Jeff Bezos, Sundar Pichai and Elon Musk stood shoulder to shoulder at the inauguration of President Donald Trump, despite their differences and, in some cases, after having once opposed him.
byline: Damien Leloup,  Alexandre Piquard and  Raphaëlle Bacqué

As World War II ended, the French Riviera became a 'GI's heaven'
subhead: 'The Summer of 1945' (6/6). To boost troop morale and keep an eye on postwar reconstruction, the US Army requisitioned dozens of hotels across southern France. This turbulent interlude marked the dawn of Americanization in French society.

headline: 'Avoid' Machu Picchu? Peru worries about the impact of mass tourism
subhead: The UNESCO World Heritage site, which attracts more than 1.5 million visitors per year, was recently deemed 'no longer worth it' by a leading global tourism platform.

headline: At Lollapalooza Paris, Olivia Rodrigo and Benson Boone rock the stage
subhead: The opening night of the Paris festival, on Friday, July 18, featured American singer Olivia Rodrigo and pop star Benson Boone, who delivered electrifying performances.
